page.title: 01The Yockleton area.
page.content: This is an area of undulating farmland crossed by a railway line and a swift brook once used to turn corn-mills. Farms range from 10 to 500 acres.Most are owned by those who work them:some let a few fields.All rear livestock and grow crops,some use intensive methods.An area of woodland is used for pheasant shooting. Victory Hall,built in 1921 next to the school and church is the only meeting place,used by Young Farmers,W.I.,Keep Fit,chapel and church groups and the Rea Board (in charge of drainage in the area). People in the area have to travel:to Shrewsbury for shops,entertainment,the dentist,to board trains:to Westbury to see the doctor:to Pontesbury for the secondary school.The nearest policeman is at Ford:fire appliances come from Worthen or Shrewsbury.
